name: Windy Wailer
description: The Windy Wailer is a large undead creature that thrives on cold and necrotic energy, characterized by its haunting presence and spectral form. It can fly and hover effortlessly, enhancing its mobility.
memorable: Its ability to mesmerize and incapacitate opponents, combined with chilling attacks and a lasting effect on victims, makes it a formidable adversary.
goals: The Windy Wailer seeks to terrify and incapacitate its foes using its chilling presence and psychic attacks.
relations: It may be encountered alongside other undead creatures or serve a more powerful necromancer.
environment: Typically found in cold, haunted locations or abandoned sites filled with necrotic energy.
strengths: High dexterity offers excellent mobility and saving throw bonuses, along with terrifying psychic abilities.
weaknesses: Susceptible to radiant damage and relies heavily on intimidation tactics.
attacks: Chilling Touch delivers necrotic and cold damage, while Wind Blast pushes foes with a chilling effect, and Frightful Gale frightens targets in a cone.
most_powerful_ability: Ghostlight mesmerizes creatures within 30 feet, incapacitating them if they fail a Wisdom saving throw.
senses: Has an exceptional passive perception score of 15.
skills: Proficient in perception, enhancing its ability to detect hidden foes.
additional_information: Can move through objects as if they were difficult terrain.
Creatures frightened by Frightful Gale can repeat saving throws to end the effect.
Victims reduced to 0 hit points by Frightful Gale gain a permanent shock of white hair upon revival.
Immunities to cold, necrotic, and poison damage make it resilient in combat.
Condition immunities and high mobility provide a significant advantage in encounters.
